Title.evidence: A Multicenter, Cluster-Randomized Controlled Trial of a Standardized Smoking Cessation Intervention for Vascular Surgery Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter, cluster-randomized trial included eight centers, randomized to provide either a standardized smoking cessation intervention or usual care.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were patients scheduled for vascular surgery or endovascular interventions.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention comprised physician 'very brief advice,' nicotine replacement therapy (NRT), and referral to a phone-based counseling service.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses a standardized intervention against usual care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was smoking cessation rate at 6 months post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted at the center level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the intervention's nature, blinding was not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 142 patients were enrolled, with 71 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In the intervention group, patients were more likely to receive physician advice (98% vs. 77%), NRT (77% vs. 13%), and quitline referral (93% vs. 33%) (all p<0.001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
